newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-ASX queries ERG over project funding.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-ASX queries ERG over project funding.

text.p: The Australian Stock Exchange said on Monday it had requested clarification from electronics group ERG Ltd over a newspaper report about the funding of the company's OneLink transport ticketing consortium in Victoria.
The Australian Financial Review newspaper reported on Monday that the bankers to the OneLink consortium had stopped funding for the project.
ERG is the project leader of OneLink. The other project partners are Mayne Nickless Ltd and Fujitsu Australia Ltd, a unit of Fujitsu Ltd of Japan.
A trading halt was applied to ERG shares earlier this morning. "The article is factually incorrect and has been written without any reference to the Company," ERG said.
"The Company has referred the article to its solicitors and will take advice as to the course of action available to it against the Financial Review," it said.

Last Thursday, the project's banker National Australia Bank Ltd advanced A$9.9 million to OneLink of which A$6.4 million has been paid to ERG. That payment was made on the scheduled date for payment and represented the payment for hardware and software delivered in the prior quarter, ERG said.
The total funds of $99.75 million will not be advanced until the full system is in operation, which is expected at the end of the 1997 year, ERG said.
ERG shares were 13 cents down at A$1.12 before the trading halt.
